title: AWS Resilient Architectures to Azure: Multi-AZ, Auto Scaling, and Disaster Recovery
description: Master resilient architecture design by implementing AWS multi-AZ deployments, auto scaling, and disaster recovery patterns, then migrating to Azure availability zones, scale sets, and site recovery solutions with enterprise-grade resilience.
prerequisites: Understanding of high availability and fault tolerance concepts
Familiarity with load balancing and auto scaling
Basic understanding of backup and recovery strategies
learningObjectives: Design and implement multi-AZ architectures in AWS and Azure
Configure auto scaling for dynamic workload management
Implement disaster recovery strategies with appropriate RTO/RPO
Set up cross-region replication and backup solutions
Implement health checks and automatic failover mechanisms

businessScenario.description: GlobalFinance Corp needs to ensure their payment processing platform maintains 99.99% uptime with automatic failover capabilities and disaster recovery across multiple regions.
requirements: Zero data loss for financial transactions
RTO of 15 minutes for critical services
RPO of 5 minutes for transaction data
Automatic scaling for peak transaction periods

sections.title: Multi-AZ High Availability Architecture
sections.content: Implement multi-AZ deployments for all critical components to ensure high availability.

hands-on.aws:
1. Deploy RDS Multi-AZ database
2. Configure EC2 instances across multiple AZs
3. Set up Application Load Balancer with cross-zone load balancing
4. Implement ElastiCache with Multi-AZ failover
5. Configure S3 with cross-region replication
hands-on.azure:
1. Deploy Azure SQL Database with zone redundancy
2. Configure VMs across availability zones
3. Set up Application Gateway with zone redundancy
4. Implement Azure Cache for Redis with geo-replication
5. Configure Storage Account with GRS

sections.title: Auto Scaling and Dynamic Workload Management
sections.content: Configure auto scaling to handle variable workloads efficiently while maintaining performance.

hands-on.aws:
1. Create Auto Scaling Groups with target tracking policies
2. Configure scaling based on CPU, memory, and custom metrics
3. Implement predictive scaling for anticipated load
4. Set up warm pools for faster scaling
5. Configure lifecycle hooks for graceful instance management
hands-on.azure:
1. Create Virtual Machine Scale Sets with autoscale rules
2. Configure scaling based on metrics and schedules
3. Implement predictive autoscaling using Azure ML
4. Set up instance warm-up periods
5. Configure custom script extensions for initialization

sections.title: Disaster Recovery Implementation
sections.content: Design and implement comprehensive disaster recovery strategies meeting business RTO/RPO requirements.

hands-on.aws:
1. Set up pilot light DR in secondary region
2. Configure AWS Backup for automated backups
3. Implement Route 53 health checks and failover routing
4. Create CloudFormation templates for DR environment
5. Test failover and failback procedures
hands-on.azure:
1. Configure Azure Site Recovery for VMs
2. Set up Azure Backup with retention policies
3. Implement Traffic Manager with failover routing
4. Create ARM templates for DR deployment
5. Conduct DR drills and validate RTO/RPO

sections.title: Data Resilience and Backup Strategies
sections.content: Implement comprehensive data protection with automated backups and replication.

hands-on.aws:
1. Configure automated RDS backups with point-in-time recovery
2. Implement S3 versioning and lifecycle policies
3. Set up cross-region snapshot copying
4. Configure EBS snapshot automation
5. Implement backup validation and testing
hands-on.azure:
1. Configure Azure SQL automated backups with PITR
2. Implement blob versioning and soft delete
3. Set up geo-redundant backup storage
4. Configure managed disk snapshots
5. Implement backup compliance reporting

sections.title: Health Monitoring and Automatic Recovery
sections.content: Implement comprehensive health checks and automatic recovery mechanisms.

hands-on.aws:
1. Configure CloudWatch alarms for all components
2. Implement EC2 auto-recovery for hardware failures
3. Set up Route 53 health checks for endpoints
4. Configure RDS event subscriptions
5. Implement automated remediation with Systems Manager
hands-on.azure:
1. Configure Azure Monitor alerts and action groups
2. Implement VM auto-recovery policies
3. Set up Traffic Manager health probes
4. Configure SQL Database automatic tuning
5. Implement automated remediation with Azure Automation

hands-onExercises.title: Build Multi-Region Active-Active Architecture
hands-onExercises.description: Design and implement a fully resilient multi-region architecture with active-active configuration.
tasks: Configure global load balancing with health checks
validation: Application remains available during AZ failure

hands-onExercises.title: Implement Chaos Engineering Tests
hands-onExercises.description: Validate resilience through controlled failure injection.

commonIssues.solution: Implement proper quorum mechanisms and conflict resolution
Pre-warm standby resources and optimize health check intervals
Ensure proper replication lag monitoring and sync validation

skillsValidation: Can design multi-AZ architectures for 99.99% availability
Can implement auto scaling for cost-effective performance
Can design DR solutions meeting specific RTO/RPO requirements
Can implement automated backup and recovery procedures
Can configure health monitoring and automatic remediation

keyConsiderations: Availability zone mapping between AWS and Azure
Differences in auto scaling behaviors and metrics

technical: RTO < 15 minutes for all critical services
business: 30% reduction in infrastructure costs through right-sizing

nextSteps: Explore advanced DR patterns (warm standby, hot standby)
Implement infrastructure as code for resilience
Practice with AWS Well-Architected Framework reliability pillar
